alert.note: Alert for Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 1:39PM CDT until August 07 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Winston County in northwestern Alabama... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 139 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Haleyville to near Bluff, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Haleyville, Lynn, Arley, Double Springs, Addison, Nauvoo, Houston Recreational Area, Camp McDowell, Nesmith, Ashbank, Brushy Lake, Poplar Springs, Ashridge, Falls City, Moreland, Smith Lake, Helicon, Inmanfield, Sardis and Corinth Rec Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
